Articles.Content:
I have just reverted my KSP install to the old version after an unexpected update. I thought I had everything fixed, but when I went to test the stock stratolauncher i encountered a problem I've never had before.

For some reason all the air intakes are closed by default and the engines start for 2 seconds then flame-out. When editing the intake options top open all the intakes, this time air is taken in and appears on the vessel resources, however the engines do the same thing and act as if there is no intake air.

 

If anyone else has this problem I am almost sure it was KSP Interstellar that was doing it.

Edited October 25, 2019 by spritefun
Added mod list.
